description.value:
Magic, one of life's greatest puzzles, has long drawn the eyes of many. It can bend, shift, and even break the laws of reality itself, or at least the laws as we know them. However, this, as with any science, requires intense knowledge of the world and how to manipulate it. Either that, or a whole lot of practice. In either case, Wizards are these spellcasters.
    Whether seeking power, knowledge, or even a way to defy death, Wizards are those who have committed to understanding the mystical sciences of spellcasting. Always experimenting and learning, Wizards are perpetually locked in the pursuit of knowledge that might further their capabilities in the magics that truly make up this world.
    Within adventuring parties, Wizards wield arcane focuses to cast spells, and are typically known for providing powerful backline assistance. Unlike other spellcasters, Wizards have the widest array of spells at their fingertips. From devastating destruction spells to powerful barriers, Wizards are the swiss army knife of the arcane. Even in melee, while Wizards traditionally do not care to be caught in the fray, they can specialize in magicks that can make even martial foes quake.

Quick Build

If you are looking to play a Wizard as quickly as possible, consider the following:

  • Intelligence should be one of your highest Attributes.
  • Either Constitution or Dexterity should be one of your next highest Attributes.
    • If you are planning to use spells from the School of Enchantment often, make Presence your second highest Attribute instead.
  • Choose @Compendium[undertaking.spells-cantrips.AH9WKC83KALKQQ19]{Elemental Cloak}, @Compendium[undertaking.spells-cantrips.IJ97BYFB2ANTKOSW]{Force of Will}, and @Compendium[undertaking.spells-cantrips.NTGJ71IJ1VDA3GS9]{Luminescence} as your Cantrips for variety.
  • Choose @Compendium[undertaking.spells-level-1.7N5KBCOM40ZX65EO]{Arcane Arrows}, @Compendium[undertaking.spells-level-1.N4PE33ACTOXHF3FJ]{Biting Wind}, @Compendium[undertaking.spells-level-1.LO6PLV28RA6CBCLU]{Burst Into Flames}, @Compendium[undertaking.spells-level-1.NI3IWI89HKX1VH6R]{Conjure Fundamental}, @Compendium[undertaking.spells-level-1.5F78LN7YILWPNJL2]{Ethereal Mail}, and @Compendium[undertaking.spells-level-1.N3BHT4QNPIDGVC6C]{Nocuous Bubble} as your 1st level spells.

system.classDetails:
Class Features at 1st Level

Class Categorization: Spellcaster
Rest Dice: 1d6
Hit Points at 1st Level: 6 + your Constitution modifier
Mana: 3

Proficiencies

Armor: None
Weapons: Choose three from: daggers, quarterstaffs, light crossbows, darts, slings, slingshots
Trades: None
Save Checks: Intelligence, Wisdom
Skills: Choose two of the following skills to be proficient in: Arcana, Craft, Culture, Insight, Investigation, Medicine, Theology.

Equipment

You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

  • (a) a quarterstaff or (b) a dagger
  • An arcane focus
  • (a) a research pack, or (b) an adventuring pack

Alternate Rule: Instead of taking any equipment from this section, instead take an arcane focus and (1d4+2) x 5 gp and spend it on items from the equipment section.
    Anything bought this way cannot be magical, with the exception of additional arcane focuses.

Starter Abilities

You gain all of the following abilities: @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.RGKNFQH7M4AJXSXV]{Spellcasting}, @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.U2NS38QP7TBT6SMG]{Wizard Spells}

Class Features at Higher Levels

Class Categorization: Spellcaster
Rest Dice Gain After 1st Level: 1d6 per Wizard level
Hit Point Gain After 1st Level:
    -  1d6 + your Constitution modifier
    -  Or 4 + your Constitution modifier
Mana: 3

Learning Spells at Higher Levels

Each time you gain a Wizard level after 1st, you can learn 2 Wizard spells of your choice.
    Each of these spells must be of a leveI for which you have access to at the time of taking that level, as described under Spellcasting in the class description for Wizard, and cannot be a Cantrip.
    For example, if you have just gotten to 4th level as a character, and you decide to take your second level in Wizard, you can only choose spells of 2nd level or below, because that is the level of spell that you meet the requirements for at the time of leveling.
    For characters that start at a higher level than 1, you will need to go through and check what spells you can take for every level of Wizard you had. For example, if you start at level 5 and put all of your levels in Wizard, you do not automatically get ten level 3 spells. You can only take two 3rd level spells in this example, because you only meet the requirements for your 5th level in Wizard, but not your 4th, 3rd, and so on.

New Ability (Skip for Growth Levels)

Each time you gain a Wizard level, unless it is a Growth Level, gain one ability of your choice from the following list or from any Wizard Sub-Class. If this is the first ability you select from a tier or sub-class then you also recieve its Given Abilities, indicated by the 🆓 symbol. If an ability has requirements listed with it then you must satisfy all of them before you can choose that ability. Likewise, if a sub-class has requirements listed with it then you must also satisfy them in order to choose any abilities from that sub-class, in addition to any requirements the chosen ability may have.

Novice Abilities

Unlock: Must have the Wizard Starter Abilities before taking any of these abilities.

Options: @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.L4TCBW3PWUZVSULN]{Book of Spells}, @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.RFBX1FZ2ALJA5G3Z]{School of Study}

Adept Abilities

Unlock: When you reach 6th level overall and 3rd level Wizard.

🆓 Given Ability: @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.SHD2ABFLNZ9CNNII]{Meditative Rest}

Options: @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.ZG3FXZY4IZX4LH6N]{Effortless Cantrips}, @Compendium[undertaking.abilities.DNKUZOHBFP8JQ80N]{Visceral Casting}

Wizard Sub-Classes: Arcane Archetype

When you meet the requirements for each sub-class, you can choose from that sub-class’ abilities. Every level taken in a Wizard sub-class counts as a wizard level.

Arcane Archetypes: @Compendium[undertaking.archetypes-wizard.DMJWB3UB89H2SRYU]{Plague Doctor}
